recipe_name: Crispy deep-fried sole with spicy mango salsa
author: Paul Rankin
method: Heat the oil in deep heavy-bottomed saucepan until very hot or until a breadcrumb sizzles in it (CAUTION: Hot oil is very dangerous. Do not leave unattended). Place the egg white and flour into a bowl an whisk together to form a smooth batter.  Add a little water if required. Dip the slices of fish in the batter and carefully lower into the hot oil.  Deep-fry for three minutes, or until golden and cooked through. For the salsa, place all the salsa ingredients into a bowl and mix together. To serve, place the salsa into the centre of a serving plate.  Place the fish on top of the salsa and garnish with the fresh chives.
ingredients: 150ml/¼ pint vegetable oil,  1 free-range egg white,  45g/1&frac12oz self-raising flour,  100g/3½oz sole, sliced into 3 pieces,  ½ mango, peeled and cut into small cubes,  ½ chilli, seeds removed,finely chopped,  ¼ onion, finely diced,  ½ lime, juice only,  fresh chives, to garnish
